content.question: Which of the following was the most important factor in the spread of the bubonic plague in Eurasia?

choices.label: The Mongol expansion from central Asia to China, eastern Europe, and the Middle East
The consolidation of western European monarchies
The spread of Buddhism from central Asia to China
The population decline and the outbreak of peasant revolts in eastern Europe

content.answer: The Mongol expansion from central Asia to China, eastern Europe, and the Middle East
